title: Contingency Tables
body: Suppose a study of speeding violations and drivers who use cell phones produced the following fictional data: Of $$305$$ people who use their phone while driving, $$25$$ have gotten a ticket in the past year, while the other $$280$$ people did not recieve a ticket. Of $$450$$ people who don't use their phone while driving, $$45$$ have gotten a ticket in the past year, while the other $$405$$ have not recieved a ticket.
